title: Grammy Awards fashion trends: Who’s going to be wearing what on the red carpet?
text:
Adele and Beyonce will both be at this year's bash (Photo: Getty) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
With the 2017 Grammy Awards just a day away, the stars will already have picked out the glitzy garms they’ll be sashaying down the red carpet in. 
And with the likes of Adele, Beyonce, Lady Gaga and Katy Perry expected to attend, this year’s event promises to be teaming with headling-hogging, show-stopping looks. 
Certain fashion trends have been taking this year’s carpets by storm, but unlike some of the more conservative shows, the Grammys is the time for celebrities to pick out some of their more daring, sexy designs. 
According to E! Fashion Police host Brad Goreski, viewers at home can expect a sprinkling of outrageousness on Sunday. What will Gaga wear? (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Brad says expect a lot more glitz on the Grammys red carpet (Photo: WireImage) 
He told Mirror Celebs: "The Grammys kind of stand alone because in music the boundaries are a little bit looser for what you can do on the red carpet. What we expect from the carpet is a mix of really fashion forward looks and a lot of outrageous looks as well.” 
Talking about trends, Brad - who styles the likes of Lea Michele - says bold stripes, whites and pretty florals have been taking over this year's red carpets. 
But for the Grammys, he says expect embellished outfits, silvers, golds and bronzes. Michelle Dockery shone in this striped gown (Photo: WireImage) Michelle Williams also opted for stripes at this year's SAG Awards (Photo: REUTERS) Read More SAG Awards 2017: The biggest fashion trends on the red carpet 
"What we have been seeing is a lot of white on the red carpet. At the Globes and also at the SAG Awards. We're seeing stripes too, which I think is something new and a little fresh. 
"Michelle Dockery was in stripes and Michelle Williams. I thought it was a nice way to do pattern, print and colour at the same time. The other one we're seeing is florals. 
"There's tons and tons of florals – floral patterns, floral lace. I think there's been a lot of interesting looks on the carpet this year, but at the Grammys I hope that we're going to be seeing a lot more embellished looks. 
"We've been seeing a lot of metallics on the runway and in the collections as well, and the Grammys is a good place to wear your gold and your silver, your bronzes - and really take the opportunity to turn up the glitz a little bit.” This is one of Brad's favourite past Grammy red carpet looks Brad says Selena Gomez always brings a good red carpet look (Photo: FilmMagic) 
And who is he most looking forward to seeing grace the carpet in Los Angeles on Sunday? 
"I'm always excited to see Beyonce of course. I also love seeing Adele on the red carpet, and rumour has it that Selena Gomez will be attending this year and she always brings a really good red carpet look." 
Live From the Red Carpet: Grammy Awards, Sunday 12th February @ 11pm, & Fashion Police: Grammy Awards Wednesday 15th February @ 9pm on E!
